ol.li: Caddo Parish is nationally recognized in the top ten for economic development by Site Selection magazine, Forbes magazine and KPMG Competitive Alternatives as the most cost competitive in the nation and in North America, respectively.

h4.a: Commission votes to allocate up to $175,000 for mobile COVID-19 testing in Caddo Parish

li.div: The Caddo Parish Commission voted on Thursday to allocate funding up to $175,000 to provide critical access to COVID-19 testing in Caddo Parish. Read on...

h4.a: Parish COVID-19 Information (Updated as new information becomes available)

li.div: In abundance of caution and for the health and safety of our citizens and parish employees, the Parish has made several changes that alter the way we provide our services. Read on...

h4.a: Cancellation of Caddo Parish Parks and Recreation events

li.div: Due to the potential high risk for serious illness from COVID-19 for older adults/senior populations, below are upcoming programs hosted by the Caddo Parish Department of Parks and Recreation that will be suspended or postponed until further notice. Read on...
With a presumptive positive case of COVID 19 present in Caddo Parish, Parish and City officials urge citizens to stay up to date with the most current information... Read on...

Salvation Army Boys and Girl Club / After-School Program
Caddo Parish Parks and Recreation serves as an official partner of the Salvation Army Boys and Girls Club After-School Program. This after-school program is for youth K-12th grade-providing supervised homework assistance, arts and craft, career readiness programs, recreational activities, social/life skill workshops, and snacks. Registration is required. For additional information, call the Salvation Army Boys and Girls Club office at (318) 636-3313.
